_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



ADUSA Distribution LLC is committed to maintain a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding community.  



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



ADUSA Distribution LLC- Mauldin FDC is located at 216 Forrester Drive in Greenville, SC. ADUSA Distribution LLC provides refrigerated warehousing and frozen storage for various food products.  In order to conduct operations, the facility maintains a refrigeration system containing approximately 25,942 pounds of anhydrous ammonia, a regulated substance.  The refrigeration system, consisting of piping, valves, and equipment, cycles ammonia through various physical states (high pressure liquid, low pressure liquid, low pressure vapor, high pressure vapor, and then back to high pressure liquid) in order to provide refrigeration for dock operations, glycol underfloor heating, and freezer storage.

 

 

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



In order to operate the ammonia refrigeration system, the facility complies with the following risk management regulations:

1) OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM); and

2) EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP).



These regulations impose numerous requirements on the facility to ensure the safety of the public and on-site workers.  The following summarizes the key compliance programs that have been implemented by ADUSA Distribution LLC- Mauldin FDC to prevent the accidental release of ammonia from the facility.  



The Operating Procedures program ensures that the ammonia system is operated in a safe manner.  



The Operator Training program ensures that personnel fully understand how to perform their jobs in a safe manner.  



The Mechanical Integrity program ensures that the ammonia system is in proper working condition based upon routine testing, inspections, and maintenance according to manufacturer's specifi

cations and industry standards.  



The Management of Change program ensures that process modifications are implemented in a safe manner.  



The Pre-Startup Safety Review program ensures that adequate safety measures are in place before ammonia is introduced into a process.  



The Hot Work Permit program ensures that ADUSA Distribution LLC- Mauldin FDC employees and contractors perform hot work (e.g. welding) in a safe manner.  



The Contractor Safety program ensures that contractors understand the hazards of ammonia and must take specified precautions to safely complete job requirements.



It is important to note that the refrigeration system has been designed with several safety features to prevent the accidental release of ammonia.  For example, the compressors are equipped with safety mechanisms that will cause the units to shut down if operating conditions exceed designated safety limits.  Also, level indicators, alarms, and switches are installed in key points within the system to monitor the supply of liquid ammonia and to ensure that a vessel is not overfilled.  The facility has also installed ammonia sensors in the Engine Room, in the cold storage areas which will alert operators in the event of an ammonia detection. 



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no federally reportable incidents nor any that resulted in serious injuries or offsite consequences within the last five years. 



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The facility has an Emergency Action Plan (plan) in effect at the facility.  This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives: 

 

- save lives;

- minimize and avoid injuries;

- protect the environment; and

- minimize property damage.



The Plan provides the notification procedures and evacuation routes for emergencies that may arise at the facility. The Facility is non-responding and has personnel trained to technically support the HazMat response team if required.





PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



ADUSA Dis
tribution LLC is committed to safe operations and will continue to identify opportunities to maintain and improve the operation of the ammonia refrigeration system.
